div.p: Austrian positivist philosopher; brother of violinist Fritz Wahle; acquaintance of Schenker’s.

div.head: Career Summary
div.p: Wahle was a student of Ernst Mach, and friend of Sigmund Freud. He rejected metaphysics (with the exception of Spinoza) and reduced psychology to a purely physiological approach. He was a lecturer at the University of Vienna 1885–95, then University Professor in Czernowitz (now Chernivtsy, Ukraine), and 1917–33 again in Vienna.

div.head: Wahle and Schenker
div.p: Only a handful of short messages from Wahle to Schenker survive, and only one of these (OJ 15/16, [2]: June 18, 1899) is of any significance: it shows Wahle’s willingness to use his influence as a respected academic to the benefit of Schenker’s brother-in-law, Salo Guttmann. Schenker acknowledged this in his appreciation of Wahle’s brother Fritz (diary entry, July 24, 1918).
